excerpt: Popular snorkeling site set among cliffs & known for clear, calm waters filled with tropical fish.
detail_description: La Piscinita, also known as "the little pool," is a popular snorkeling site located on the western coast of the island. This natural swimming pool is nestled among rugged cliffs and offers crystal clear, calm waters that are teeming with tropical fish. The entrance fee is minimal but well worth it for the opportunity to swim in this naturally formed pool and observe the marine life in its shallow and warm environment.
name: La Piscinita
address: 01, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: Natural phenomenon where a hole in the beach shoots out ocean water when there are strong waves.
detail_description: Hoyo Soplador, also known as the blow hole, is a unique natural phenomenon located on the rocky shores of an island's south side. When strong waves hit the rocks, air is forced up through a hole in the coral, creating a geyser that shoots seawater high into the air. Visitors can experience this thrilling sight about once every minute and may get drenched if standing nearby.
name: Hoyo Soplador
address: F7J9+PG, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: Minute island with a simple beach bar, a shipwreck & clear waters for snorkeling.
detail_description: Rocky Cay is a small island off the coast of San Andres, offering a simple beach bar and clear waters perfect for snorkeling. The area is known for its wonderful beaches like Spratt Bight Beach, Johnny Cay Beach, and more. Visitors can relax, sunbathe, rent yachts for aquatic tours or enjoy water sports such as snorkeling and kayaking.
name: Rocky Cay
address: Isla de, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: This wide beach has warm & shallow waters allowing visitors to wade out or swim.
detail_description: Playa Spratt Bight is the most famous and bustling beach in San Andres, conveniently located in the heart of the city. Its calm, shallow waters and expansive sandy shores make it an ideal spot for swimming and leisurely sea activities such as kayaking, paddleboarding, and snorkeling. The beach is surrounded by shops, restaurants, and bars offering a lively atmosphere even after sunset.
name: Playa Spratt Bight
address: a 2-244, Cl. 1 #2-24, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: San Andrés is a small Colombian island off Nicaragua in the Caribbean. It’s known for its white-sand beaches, coconut palms, clear water and all-inclusive resorts. Part of an archipelago that includes Providencia and Santa Catalina, the island has a culture blending Latin American, English and Creole influences. It's also home to expansive coral reefs and diverse marine life.
detail_description: San Andrés, a charming Colombian island in the Caribbean, is renowned for its stunning white-sand beaches, swaying coconut palms, and crystal-clear waters. The island forms part of an archipelago that includes Providencia and Santa Catalina, boasting a unique cultural blend of Latin American, English, and Creole influences. San Andrés is also famous for its expansive coral reefs teeming with diverse marine life.
name: San Andrés
address: San Andres and Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: Tourist attraction consisting of an underground cave with a pirate theme, including a replica ship.
detail_description: Morgan's Cave is a popular tourist attraction located in the southern part of San Andres. It is an underground cave with a pirate theme, featuring a replica ship and stalactites and stalagmites that create an impressive sight. The cave is said to be connected to the ocean and has been associated with the legendary privateer Henry Morgan, sparking interest in treasure hunting. While it may require some imagination to fully appreciate, it is often included as a stop on island tours.
name: Morgan's Cave
address: San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: Colorful waterside Colombia restaurant offering hearty comfort plates, seafood dishes & cocktails.
detail_description: La Regatta is a vibrant restaurant located by the waterside in Colombia, known for its hearty comfort plates, seafood dishes, and cocktails. It's a favorite among many for special occasions due to its high-quality food and top-notch service. The restaurant offers an experience even before dining, with a colorful pier adorned with local art and relics of a pirate ship. The menu features upscale options like hot garlic crab claws, lobster tail in bechamel, and conch in coconut sauce.
name: La Regatta
address: Cra. 1 #3 - 121, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: El Acuario in San Andres, Colombia is a popular tourist spot known for its vibrant marine life. Situated near the main beach of San Andres, this sea aquarium allows visitors to closely interact with diverse marine species from the Caribbean Sea. Despite being crowded at times, it remains a must-visit destination for tourists seeking an immersive experience with underwater creatures.
name: El acuario san andres
address: Avenida La Playa Esquina Duarte Peatonal, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Laguna Big Pond, situated in Barrio La Loma, is a large freshwater body measuring 400 x 150 meters and over 30 meters deep. The area is teeming with diverse flora and fauna including palms, mango trees, babillas, iguanas, turtles, and various bird species. Managed by a Rastafarian community, the pond is home to domesticated alligators that can be observed swimming near the shore when called.
name: Laguna Big Pond
address: San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Cocoplum Bay is a serene and unspoiled beach, offering calm surroundings and clear waters perfect for swimming and relaxation. It is less crowded, providing a beautiful stretch of soft white sand bordered by crystal-clear waters. This secluded refuge is ideal for those seeking to escape the hustle and bustle and immerse themselves in a tranquil natural environment. Visitors can capture stunning panoramic views, especially during sunset.
name: Cocoplum Bay
address: Cl. 17 #3-9, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: When exploring the stunning Acuario, be sure to visit Haynes Cay, a charming coral cay that showcases the vibrant Caribbean wildlife. This picturesque spot is not only a feast for the eyes but also offers delightful dining options where you can savor local culinary delights. Just nearby, Rose Cay presents an enchanting sandbank that transforms with the tides, creating a unique experience every time you visit.
name: Haynes Cay
address: San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: Scenic Colombian island known for its coral reefs, reggae music, water sports & wildlife sanctuary.
detail_description: San Andrés is a picturesque Colombian island renowned for its stunning coral reefs, vibrant reggae music scene, and plethora of water sports activities. The island boasts an array of attractions, including the captivating San Andres Town beach and the idyllic Johnny Cay with its palm-shaded shores and resident iguanas. Visitors can embark on boat trips from San Andres to Johnny Cay and Acuario, a charming sandbar off the east coast known for its crystal-clear waters.
name: San Andrés
address: San Andres and Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: Jumping-off spot with clear seas for snorkeling & fish-feeding, plus a water slides & sunset views.
detail_description: Eco Parque West View is a must-visit attraction in San Andres, Colombia. It's known for its crystal-clear waters and vibrant marine life, making it a natural aquarium that offers an incredible snorkeling experience. Situated on the west side of the island, this spot allows visitors to swim among colorful coral formations and various fish species. Unlike traditional beaches, West View is all about enjoying the clear water and excellent visibility for snorkeling and fish feeding.
name: Eco Parque West View
address: San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Reggae Roots is a rasta-themed bar and restaurant located on the west side of an island, offering a stunning view of the Caribbean ocean at sunset. It's recommended to arrive early to secure a lounge chair and enjoy drinks while watching the sun go down. The place features a cliff-side diving board for those seeking some excitement, as well as snorkeling pools and a giant Poseidon statue submerged in clear waters.
name: Reggae Roots
address: 01, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Located on the highest hill of San Andres, La Loma is a charming village offering stunning views of the seven-colored Caribbean Sea. This historic settlement is also home to the oldest Baptist church in the archipelago, Iglesia-Bautista-Emmanuel, dating back to the 16th and 17th centuries.
name: La Loma
address: San Andrés, San Andres and Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Johnny Cay is a charming little island that offers a perfect getaway for beach lovers. Visitors can enjoy the crystal-clear waters and powdery sand beaches while sipping on refreshing drinks like pina coladas. The island has multiple vendors offering food and drinks, with options to rent umbrellas and chairs for a comfortable beach day. English-speaking locals with a Caribbean accent add to the laid-back vibe, making it an ideal spot to spend the entire day relaxing by the sea.
name: Johnny Cay
address: Colombia

excerpt: Beach site with boat access, known for snorkeling, swimming & sea urchins (shoes recommended).
detail_description: Cayo Acuario, also known as the Aquarium of San Andres, is a popular beach destination located east of San Andres. Accessible by boat, this tiny island is renowned for its abundant marine life and excellent snorkeling opportunities. The shallow and warm waters teem with colorful fish and other aquatic creatures, offering visitors a chance to swim alongside them. Additionally, the island provides a picturesque setting with its tiny white sand beach and crystal-clear blue waters.
name: Cayo Acuario
address: Colombia

detail_description: Vía Cueva de Morgan is a submerged cave that has gained notoriety as the rumored hiding place of Captain Morgan's treasure. The cave's entrance is visible from above water, but it is inaccessible for exploration. Legend has it that the notorious pirate stashed some of his riches within its depths, adding an air of mystery and intrigue to this underwater marvel.
name: Vía Cueva de Morgan
address: San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Rose Cay is a popular spot that can be reached with a short swim or walk from Haynes Cay. Despite the crowds, visitors can still have an enjoyable experience. It's recommended to bring your own snorkeling gear and water shoes to fully appreciate the colorful marine life in the clear waters. Additionally, there's a resident nurse shark nearby for those interested in underwater photography. The area is not overly crowded as ships are kept at a good distance, allowing for a more peaceful atmosphere.
name: Rose Cay
address: H826+6P, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Nestled atop a ridge road that runs through San Andres, the Mirador Paisajístico Torre First Baptist Church is a historical gem and the oldest Baptist church in Latin America, established in 1847. The current structure, built in 1898 from timber shipped all the way from Alabama, offers visitors breathtaking views of the island. While exploring this charming church, take a moment to appreciate its simple yet beautiful architecture and delve into its rich history showcased within an adjacent museum.
name: Mirador Paisajístico Torre First Baptist Church
address: La Loma, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Playa Principal, also known as Spratt Bight Beach, is a popular destination on San Andres Island. Its white sand and clear turquoise waters make it a favorite among visitors. The beach offers plenty of space for relaxation and is ideal for swimming due to its calm waves. While some may find the presence of algae to be a drawback, there are numerous restaurants and facilities nearby, making it convenient for visitors.
name: Playa Principal
address: Isla de, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Located just a short drive from San Andres town, Jardín Botánico de San Andrés is a peaceful oasis boasting lush vegetation, native plants, and vibrant blooms. Part of the National University of Colombia, it serves as a hub for students worldwide to study in its nursery, laboratory, and herbarium. Guided tours offer insights into the island's prehistoric flora and modern conservation efforts.
name: Jardín Botánico de San Andrés
address: Av. Loma Barrack, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Playa Charquitos is a hidden gem nestled at the southern tip of San Andres, renowned for its serene atmosphere and welcoming vibe. This tranquil beach is embraced by an array of protective reefs that not only calm the waters but also create a safe haven from strong ocean currents and predatory marine life. With its shallow depths, Playa Charquitos is perfect for families with young children, offering a safe environment where little ones can splash around without worry.
name: Playa Charquitos
address: 01, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

excerpt: Airy rooms, some with beach views, in a laid-back hotel offering open-air dining & an outdoor pool.
detail_description: Hotel Bahía Sardina is a laid-back hotel offering airy rooms, some with beach views, and open-air dining. It's located on the beautiful Spratt Bight beach in the north of San Andres Island, making it perfect for a vacation. The hotel features an outdoor pool and modern rooms with free Wi-Fi. With its proximity to the main sites in the center and a restaurant on-site, guests can enjoy convenience without having to walk far.
name: Hotel Bahía Sardina
address: Av. Colombia #5A-29, San Andrés, San Andres Islas, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Parque Nacional Manglares de Old Point is a stunning natural reserve located on San Andres Island, renowned for its expansive mangrove ecosystems that play a crucial role in safeguarding the island from harsh ocean conditions. Visitors can embark on an exciting boat ride aboard a Pontoon, accommodating groups of 5 to 18 people, to explore picturesque spots like El Acuario and White Wata, where the striking white coral sands create breathtaking views.
name: Parque Nacional Manglares de Old Point
address: San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Faro Haynes Cay is a popular destination in San Andres, often included in boat tours along with Johnny Cay, El Acuario, and Mantarrayas. Some tours may also stop at Manglares. Despite being crowded even outside of peak season, Faro Haynes Cay is considered a must-see for its stunning beauty. Visitors have described it as simply amazing and the most beautiful beach in San Andres.
name: Faro Haynes Cay
address: Colombia

excerpt: Coral-fringed white sandy beach with hotel rooms & restaurants lapped by turquoise Caribbean waters.
detail_description: Playa San Luis is a picturesque coastal area located on the east side of the island, offering a serene escape from the bustling city. The beach boasts coral-fringed white sands and clear turquoise waters, perfect for relaxation and snorkeling when the sea is calm. The village of San Luis provides a tranquil atmosphere with its traditional wooden houses and plentiful options for affordable food and drinks. Visitors can explore nearby Playa Rocky Cay, which is more developed but equally stunning, or discover secluded beaches along the coast.
name: Playa San Luis
address: San Luis, San Andrés, San Andres and Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Capitán Mandy is a mid-range seafood restaurant located in San Andres Island, Colombia. It is known for its delicious Caribbean and Latin cuisine, offering a cozy atmosphere and exceptional service. The menu features recommended dishes such as fried fish and seafood. While the restaurant mainly focuses on seafood, it also offers limited vegetarian options like vegetarian rice and pasta with garlic and veggies. Visitors have praised the quality of the dishes considering the restaurant's specialty in seafood.
name: Capitán Mandy
address: #4b-2 a, Av Providencia #446, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Beer Station in San Andrés is a popular spot offering American cuisine, fast food, and a bar. Located on Avenida Colombia 1a-16 Lc 102, it's known for its diverse menu featuring hamburgers, wings, ribs, chicken fingers, and hot dogs. The restaurant offers little tables for sharing where you can sample a variety of dishes. While the prices may seem high in Colombian pesos, they are quite affordable when compared to the euro.
name: Beer Station - San Andrés
address: Av. Colombia #55a1, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Rocky Cay Restaurant Bar & Beach is a beachfront spot with abundant and shareable food, providing a nice break from the hustle of el Centro. The place offers good food in a beachy and pleasant setting right on the sand. Visitors can enjoy giant fish and great chicken dishes at reasonable prices. The staff is known for their excellent service and friendliness, making it the best option for those visiting Rocky Cay beach.
name: Rocky Cay Restaurant Bar & Beach
address: 01, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Acuario San Andres is a stunning destination with crystal-clear waters and abundant marine life. Visitors can enjoy snorkeling and observe a variety of fish in the area. While the island can get crowded, it offers an opportunity for amazing interactions with marine creatures. The presence of security and rescue teams ensures safety, making it a great place to spend time in the water.
name: Acuario San andres
address: Islote cordoba, Colombia

detail_description: Piscinita is a popular beach destination known for its popularity and crowds. It is located on the southwest coast and can be reached by motorbike or golf cart. If you're looking to relax, this beach is worth a visit despite the large number of visitors it attracts.
name: Piscinita
address: San Andrés, San Andres and Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Pueblito Isleño is a charming and picturesque village located in the heart of the Colombian Caribbean. This colorful town is known for its vibrant architecture, cobblestone streets, and lively atmosphere. Visitors can explore the local shops, enjoy traditional Colombian cuisine at the restaurants, and immerse themselves in the rich cultural heritage of the region. The town also offers stunning views of the surrounding landscapes and provides a glimpse into the laid-back island lifestyle.
name: Pueblito Isleño
address: G7VC+22, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

detail_description: Casino Arena, located in the breathtaking San Andres Islands, is a remarkable gambling establishment that offers an exceptional experience for those seeking excitement and entertainment. This impressive casino boasts an array of thrilling games and activities to satisfy even the most discerning players. With its outstanding amenities and top-notch facilities, Casino Arena guarantees a superior level of enjoyment and satisfaction. Whether you're a seasoned gambler or just looking to have fun, this superb venue ensures non-stop action and high-quality service.
name: CASINO ARENA
address: Cra. 1, San Andrés, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia

name: Exhibición Marina The Persistence
address: Cove, antiguo colegio adventista del 7 día, San Andrés y Providencia, Colombia
